result.execSummary:
Joshua M. Heller was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Joshua M. Heller was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua M. Heller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jack C. Hoag in court.  Cheniqua White appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft has been Extradited.

Defendant Joshua M. Heller in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Scott H. Dirks appeared with Intern Christa Johnson for the State of Wisconsin. Deft WAIVES Extradition freely and voluntairly; BOND REVOKED;  Further proceedings scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua M. Heller in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury for Jack C. Hoag.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Continued Extradition Hearing 06-02-2015 at 8:30am "B"
